dc:title: From Union Square to Rome Dorothy Day 1938, Chapter 7, pp. 71-89. Describes her life as an advocacy journalist depicting the misery of the poor and working class. Engages in picketing, organizing, and anti-conscription activities. An account of being jailed with suffragettes and their hunger strike. Theme of being "tormented by God" and impulses toward faith recurs.
